Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Share_Data.description: Reference to the business asset for which the asset shares will be created or maintained.

validation.validation: You can't maintain asset shares for discrete composite assets.
You can't maintain asset shares for removed assets.
You can't maintain asset shares when the asset has pending events.
You can't maintain asset shares for assets that aren't registered.
You can't maintain asset shares for disposed assets.
You can't maintain asset shares for assets that are components of a nondiscrete composite asset.
You can't maintain asset shares for assets with a lease spend category.
validation.description: You can't maintain asset shares for assets with a lease spend category.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

Asset_Share_Data.description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.
The effective date of the newly created or changed shares.

validation.validation: Select a Transaction Effective Date that is on or between the asset's acquisition date and today.
Enter a Transaction Effective Date for the transfer that is on or between the last issue date and today.
The fiscal Period for the transaction date must exist in the fiscal schedule of every company asset book where this is a depreciable asset in order to do this transaction
Transaction effective date of this transaction cannot be prior to last partial disposal date for asset
Transaction effective date of this transaction cannot be prior to last reclassification date for asset
Enter a Transaction Effective Date for an existing ledger period.

Asset_Share_Replacement_Data.description: This is a unique reference identifier for the asset share.
The amount of the asset share.

validation.validation: The Asset Share Amount entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point.
Amount cannot be positive.
Amount cannot be negative.

Asset_Share_Replacement_Data.description: The percent of the asset share.

validation.validation: Share Percent must be less than 100%.
Share Percent must be greater than zero.
You can't enter both Asset Share Amount and Asset Share Percentage on the Maintain Asset Share Web Service.
You must enter either Asset Amount or Share Percentage.

Asset_Share_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: [missing worktags for spend and item]
[non-allowed worktags for spend, item and location]
[partitionable] is not allowed to be used by [company].
Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
The following Asset Worktag types are invalid: [invalid]
The following Asset Worktags are required but have not been assigned: [missing]
[invalid worktag value message]

Asset_Share_Data.description: Element containing asset share replacement data

validation.validation: You can't enter both Asset Share Amount and Asset Share Percentage on the Maintain Asset Share Web Service.
The Total Asset Share percentage should equal 100.
The sum of the asset share amounts ([share amounts]) must equal the cost of the asset: [asset cost]

description: Element containing the business asset and its corresponding asset shares
